meanings.definition: The lack of ability to conduct electricity.
meanings.sent1: Nonconduction is when something cannot carry electricity.
meanings.sent2: Rubber is a good example of nonconduction because it does not allow electricity to pass through.
meanings.sent3: The nonconduction of the plastic spoon made it impossible to use as a conductor in the science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a nonconduction zone, impervious to the electric thoughts of others.
meanings.sent5: The nonconduction of the material was so strong that even a lightning bolt couldn't pass through.

meanings.definition: The act of not conducting heat or electricity.
meanings.sent1: Nonconduction prevents the flow of heat or electricity.
meanings.sent2: In extreme cold, nonconduction helps keep the body warm by trapping heat.
meanings.sent3: The nonconduction of the ice cube was so effective that it didn't melt even in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The nonconduction of the metal rod turned it into an icy pole in the winter wind.
meanings.sent5: The nonconduction of the ceramic mug kept the coffee warm for hours.
